question.text: How many types of RNA polymerase required for RNA synthesis?

options.text: In prokaryotes, three different types of RNA polymerases are required, where RNA polymerase II transcribes mRNA genes and 5S rRNA genes.
In eukaryotes, three different types of RNA polymerases are required, where RNA polymerase II transcribes mRNA genes and 5S rRNA genes.
In eukaryotes, three different types of RNA polymerases are required, where RNA polymerase II transcribes mRNA, miRNA, snRNA genes.
In eukaryotes, five different types of RNA polymerases are required, where RNA polymerase III transcribes mRNA, miRNA, snRNA and snoRNA genes.

solution.text: Eukaryotes have three types of RNA polymerases: RNA polymerase I transcribe rRNA genes, RNA polymerase II transcribes mRNA, miRNA, snRNA, and snoRNA genes, and RNA polymerase III transcribes tRNA and 5S rRNA genes.
